summary: Internal email correspondence regarding a CBS News inquiry about reports that at least 8 jail officials knew Jeffrey Epstein was not to be left alone in his cell leading up to his death. The email shows the news organization seeking confirmation and comment on these reports.

persons.name: Bridget Brown
persons.context: News Associate at CBS News National Desk who sent the inquiry email regarding reports about jail officials and Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased individual at the center of the case, whose death in jail is the subject of the CBS News inquiry.

events.title: CBS News Inquiry on Epstein Jail Death
events.description: CBS News sends an inquiry regarding reports that at least 8 jail officials knew Jeffrey Epstein was not to be left alone in his cell leading up to his death.

keyFacts: CBS News was investigating reports that at least 8 jail officials knew Jeffrey Epstein was not to be left alone in his cell prior to his death.
The inquiry was sent by Bridget Brown, a News Associate at the CBS News National Desk, on August 21, 2019.
The email indicates media scrutiny and ongoing questions about the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death in custody.
